sentences: Teades et tegu on kallis, ostsin ikka.
Ma sõitsin teades, et pean kohale jõudma.
Teades teda paremini, ei oodanki midagi head.
context: The Estonian word 'teades' is an adessive form of the verb 'teadma' (to know). It functions as a converb or gerund in English, expressing that something is done with knowledge of certain circumstances. It's commonly used at the beginning of sentences to indicate awareness of a particular fact before stating the main clause.
